Nobody should go broke over this life-saving drug, and I'll keep pushing until the cost of insulin is capped for everybody.

I’ve always said Schatz is one of the smarter people I’ve served with.

UPDATE: My effort with @lisamurkowski to right a wrong and get these Montana counties the resources they need passed again as part of the must-pass federal budget package. We're making sure this gets done.

BREAKING: The Senate has finally passed a full federal budget—giving our armed forces the certainty needed to keep America safe.

This legislation maintains our military's edge, provides for our veterans, and strengthens rural America. I'm confident it will deliver for Montana.

We need to stop fentanyl from coming across our borders. My bills—soon to be laws—will target fentanyl trafficking at the source so we can stop this illicit drug from devastating Montana's communities.

@elonmusk @SenatorSinema Absolutely and there is money in our amendment to secure the southern border. Senator Lee’s amendment included zero dollars for border security. Ours included more than $8 billion for things like physical barriers and tech.

@elonmusk @SenatorSinema That claim is false. Our amendment was a good-faith effort to take proposals that both Democrats and Republicans claim they support. Both parties have failed to secure our southern border and fix our broken immigration system. We need to get serious about solving this problem.

Happy Hanukkah! Sharla and I are sending our best to the families in Montana and around the world who are beginning their celebrations tonight. May this holiday season bring you peace and good health.

The Senate has sent the national defense bill to the President's desk.

Mental health is one of the biggest challenges of our time. We've got to do all we can to continue improving both access to mental health care, as well as the care itself.

If you or someone you know is struggling with mental health, call 800-950-6264 or text "NAMI" to 741741.

Support shouldn't be hard to find or afford. That's why I'm working to get Medicare to cover mental health services, and why I've worked with both parties to simplify and strengthen the National Suicide Prevention and Mental Health Crisis Hotline.

We also have to keep in mind the folks who work their tails off caring for us: our health care professionals.

These heroes have been put through the wringer these last two years, which is why we codified protections for their mental health into law at the end of last year.

When it comes to caring for our fighting men and women, we must remember there are unseen wounds of war.

We passed my Hannon Act to bolster VA's mental health workforce and increase rural veterans' access to care, and I'm pushing to ensure it’s implemented as Congress intended.

We can't ignore the mental health crisis happening in rural America.

My Seeding Rural Resilience Act and the funding I secured for mobile services were critical first steps, but we need to double down by passing my bills to expand tele-mental health services and coverage.

Mental health is as important as physical health, and it's critical to address challenges early.

We invested in school mental health services with the American Rescue Plan, and I've got a bill to build on these resources and give students the tools they need for the long haul.

Folks, we all struggle or know someone who struggles with mental health. That's why we've got to keep working to ensure everyone has access to the care and services they need.

As @SVACDems Chairman, I sent a letter last week urging VA Secretary McDonough for more transparency with the Program to help us hold the VA accountable and ensure we're adequately supporting caregivers like Dara in Montana and throughout the nation.

They deserve nothing less.

The Department also announced a plan to refine the eligibility requirements to ensure the Caregivers Program is meeting the intent of Congress.

I was glad to see the Biden Administration take our concerns and the concerns of veterans and caregivers across the country seriously.

Together, we held VA's feet to the fire.

We held hearings. We sent letters. We got input from VA officials, VSOs, and caregivers on how to improve the Program.

And just last month, VA announced a slew of changes—including a halt on discharging legacy participants.

A few years ago, the previous administration was set to tighten the Program's eligibility requirements and unfairly deny access.

Hearing concerns from veterans and caregivers alike, I raised hell—but they did it anyways.

Tomy and Dara are two of many Montanans who know firsthand how vital the Caregivers Program is to our vets. Tomy sacrificed a whole lot for our country, and Dara had to work part-time to help him get the care he deserved.

Family farm agriculture is vital to our nation's food security, and I'll never stop fighting to defend our great tradition. From one farmer to another, happy #NationalAgDay!

Farmers will save time and money when we pass my long overdue Agriculture Right to Repair Act. This bill will force big equipment manufacturers to make software and tools available on reasonable terms so farmers can fix their own equipment—just as they've always done.

We've been fighting for years to cut red tape and expand access to interstate markets for Montana ranchers, and yesterday, we made a lot of progress.

We need to provide certainty for producers across the country and pass my New Markets for State-Inspected Meat and Poultry Act.

Everyone west of the Mississippi knows that Montana beef is a cut above the rest.

It's critical for Montana families to know exactly what they're buying at the supermarket, and my bipartisan American Beef Labeling Act will ensure ONLY American beef is marked "Product of USA."

We've got to keep small operations strong, and fair and transparent prices are essential to that. With my bipartisan spot pricing bill, we'll establish regional mandatory minimum thresholds for negotiated cash and grid cattle trades to ensure producers can meet their bottom line.

For years, anti-competitive practices in the meatpacking industry have been running family ranchers out of business.

It's time we crack down and put real teeth in the Packers and Stockyards Act—my bipartisan Meat Packing Special Investigator Act will do just that.

A whole lot of people in Congress claim to understand what folks in production ag need—but a lot fewer of them actually do.

I'm fighting to pass commonsense bills to address consolidation in the industry and get our family farmers and ranchers a fair shake. 🧵 #NationalAgDay

These are some effective steps I'm fighting for that'll bring down the cost of prescription drugs for Montana seniors and families.

Congress has done a lot of talking about reining in drug costs, but it's high time we start doing. Montanans don't have time to waste. (8/8)

Lastly, and this is a big one, we need to get aggressive on lowering the cost of prescription drugs like insulin. Insulin is essential for some folks to live—yet the cost of a single vial has skyrocketed.

We need to make insulin affordable right away. (7/8)
We've also got to cap out-of-pocket costs for Medicare Part D patients, as well as eliminate the Part D coverage gap to ensure more folks can access the drugs they need. (6/8)
In recent years, we have seen some companies jack up the costs of vital prescription drugs for no other reason than they can—and that's just plain wrong. (5/8)

Montana seniors need relief immediately, and another way we can tackle this issue head on is by letting Medicare negotiate prescription drug prices.

With this power, Medicare can leverage its large market share to bring down prices for beneficiaries. Let's make it happen. (4/8)

But the work isn’t done yet. This week, I led a bipartisan group of 30 Senators in urging @CMSGov to stop all retroactive DIR fees, period. This commonsense reform could reduce seniors' out-of-pocket drug costs by more than $21 billion over the next decade. (3/8)

In December, I secured a commitment from @CMSGov to address hidden DIR fees charged by corporate middlemen that drive up drug costs for patients and put small pharmacies out of business.

Cracking down on these fees will lower drug costs for Medicare Part D beneficiaries. (2/8)

I'll tell you flat out—prescription drug costs are out of control.

But there are steps we can take to lower these outrageous costs, and it's time for Congress to get serious and take action. 🧵

Transparency makes our democracy stronger.

These commonsense reforms will help ensure our democracy works for everyone—not just the wealthy and well connected. (8/8)

And last but not least, my Spotlight Act shines a light on dark money donors and gives the government the tools it needs to enforce our campaign finance laws, reversing a Trump-era rule that eliminated donor disclosure requirements for certain tax-exempt organizations. (7/8)

The Honest Ads Act would require disclaimers on digital ads and require large online platforms to keep a public database of who is purchasing political ads—ensuring digital ads have the same requirements as those on TV or radio and letting folks know who is paying for them. (6/8)

The DISCLOSE Act would keep foreign actors from participating in American elections and increase transparency for major donors, so Montanans know exactly who is paying for the constant ads that flood their TVs and mailboxes during election season. (5/8)

The Cleaning Up Washington's Act, another bill of mine, would close the revolving door between D.C. lobbyists and Capitol Hill by banning former members of Congress and the Executive Branch from lobbying for five years after leaving civil service. (4/8)

I've also got the SUN Act, which would bring political spending out of the shadows by requiring tax-exempt non-profit organizations that engage in political activity to publicly disclose information about their big money online donors. (3/8)

My Corporations Are Not People Act is a constitutional amendment that would overturn the Supreme Court's harmful Citizens United decision and declare once and for all that corporations are NOT people. (2/8)

Citizens United is one of the worst decisions SCOTUS ever made. It opened the dark money floodgates and gave special interests too much power over our elections.

I am closely monitoring the fast-moving Richard Springs Fire, which has led to evacuation orders for the towns of Lame Deer and Ashland. We owe a deep debt of gratitude to our firefighters and first responders who are working hard to contain the fire and keep our communities safe

Ultimately, my bipartisan legislation is about two things: creating good-paying jobs for Montanans and ensuring we remain the leading economic power in the world. This bill does that and more, and I’m proud to have worked with Republicans and Democrats to get it passed.

Water 🚰💧
 
Water is life. This legislation completes all authorized Indian water rights settlements in Montana, and I secured $1 billion to complete all authorized rural water projects through the Bureau of Reclamation, as well as up to $100 million for the Milk River Project.

Fire Resiliency 🧑‍🚒👨‍🚒
 
Fire season has gotten worse year after year in Montana, and that’s why this bill includes $3.37 billion to reduce wildfire risk through additional funding for firefighter salaries, research, and community resiliency.

High-Speed Internet 💻📶
 
This legislation provides billions to expand high-speed internet to underserved areas and it will increase connectivity in every corner of Montana so we can create good-paying jobs and grow our small businesses.

Roads and bridges 🛣🌉
 
Montana’s economy depends on safe, efficient travel across our state, and this package invests roughly $2.82 billion to repair and upgrade Montana’s roads, highways, and bridges.

Months ago I joined 4 Democrats and 5 Republicans to invest in our nation’s critical infrastructure needs, create good-paying jobs, and maintain our economic advantage over China.
 
Today our bipartisan legislation passed the Senate – here’s some of what I secured for Montana:

Washington has talked about making significant investments in our nation’s crumbling infrastructure for years – our Bipartisan group took action.

This package will create good-paying Montana jobs and keep our economic advantage over China.
